ये वही सचिन पायलेट हे जो राजस्थान मे मुखियमत्री बनने का हे इसने मोदी जी के पोस्टर पर उनके चेहरे पर काला कर रहा है इसको इतना फलाओ कि कल तक हर न्युज चेनल पर आ जाए (This is the same Sachin Pilot who is going to be the Chief Minister of Rajasthan. He has blackened Modi ji’s poster. Spread this so much that every news channel covers it by tomorrow- translation). A photograph showing a young man dressed in a white kurta pyjama blackening the face of PM Narendra Modi on a poster has gone viral on social media with the aforementioned message.
ये वही सचिन पायलेट हे जो राजस्थान मे मुखियमत्री बनने का हे इसने मोदी जी के पोस्टर पर उनके चेहरे पर काला कर रहा है इसको इतना फलाओ कि कल तक हर न्युज चेनल पर आ जाए
Posted by Namo Narendra Modi ji on Thursday, December 13, 2018

The above post is from the Facebook page Namo Narendra Modi ji. The page has over 200,000 followers. Numerous individual users have shared this message and the photographs on both Facebook and Twitter.

The person seen blackening the poster is not Rajasthan Congress leader Sachin Pilot, and the photograph is unrelated to the recent assembly elections. Loksatta, a popular Marathi daily had carried this photograph along with a report on October 11, 2018. Satyajeet Tambe, the president of the Maharashtra Youth Congress had blackened a poster of PM Modi during protests over rising fuel prices. The protest had taken place in Mumbai and was organised by the Maharashtra Youth Congress.

Alt News has observed that of late, misinformation is not restricted to the run-up to elections but continues after conclusion of polling and declaration of verdict. This was observed earlier with respect to the Karnataka election. However, this time, misinformation post elections has been disseminated with greater frequency and intensity than before.

Arjun Sidharth is a writer with Alt News. He has previously worked in the television news industry, where he managed news bulletins and breaking news scenarios, apart from scripting numerous prime time television stories. He has also been actively involved with various freelance projects. Sidharth has studied economics, political science, international relations and journalism. He has a keen interest in books, movies, music, sports, politics, foreign policy, history and economics. His hobbies include reading, watching movies and indoor gaming.
